mot.axs.syncWayWindow.toolTip: To synchronize to a master axis, specify either a fix direction (positive, negative) or a dynamic setting (shortest distance) when starting a synchronization command of the slave axis (e.g. gear-in-pos). If the position difference between the two axes is smaller than the specified value (shortest way window), it is synchronized the shortest distance possible.

mot.axs.syncSecDescription: In case of '0', the axis limit values are used as default values.

mot.kin.calloutMessage:
Based on the World Coordinate System (WCS), one or more sets can be defined. Using the offsets, the coordinate of each
set
can be shifted in X-, Y- and Z-direction and rotated around the Z-axis, the new Y-axis (Y') and the resulting Z-axis
(Z).
The shifting and rotation is always relative to the entry below.

mot.kin.noWATextRunning: To add areas, switch from 'Running' to 'Configuration' first.
mot.kin.noWAText:
'Add area' creates either an area into which a kinematics (TCP) is not allowed to enter (SAFE_ZONE) or not allowed to leave (WORKING_AREA).

To include configured areas into the path calculation of a kinematics, enable them before.

mot.kin.areaErrorRspnDialogTitle: Error response for area monitoring during execution
mot.kin.areaErrorRxnDescription.tooltip: This will only be taken into account if the areas are checked during execution, i.e the end command option kinSafeAreaInExecution is set for the kinematics. Otherwise, a LIGHT_ERROR is set in the event of violation.
mot.kin.areaErrorRxn_lightError.desc: The kinematics are stopped on the path with the last limit value used.
mot.kin.areaErrorRxn_severeError.desc: The kinematics are stopped immediately (leaving the path).
mot.kin.areaErrorRspnDesc: monitors compliance with the work areas and safety zones during program execution. if a conflict with the areas is detected. one of the following reactions can be executed.
mot.kin.disableButtonsWhenWCSAndPCSIsActive.tool: Jogging in WCS and TCS is currently not supported when a PCS is selected. Please change the coordinate system or deactivate the PCS

cartesian.name: Cartesian (simple)
cartesian.description: Joint transformation for simple Cartesian kinematics without axis offsets, implicit axis assignment and without orientation.
